channel.title: Food Habits ( Healthy Living )
channel.description:
Now i know lot's of people on here are kids or young adults but I also know there is lot's of older and more mature (not that some young adults are not mature) people on these forums.
I have recently started eating healthy or reasonably healthy
Example of my daily food intake: Breakfast Tea (not in packet or bag) with honey and/or 86% cacao (not cocoa) (from distilled or spring water) Oatmeal (cooked in spring water gotten from a underground pump by my house or distilled water) Fruit
Snacks: (throughout school day) Raw Almonds Raw Sunflower Seeds
Lunch: Fruit's Vegetable's Mission corn chips (sometimes) Granola Bar (with the least ingredients that i can find in a grocery store) All natural trail mix or make my own (usually dried cranberry, almonds or peanuts, soy beans, other dried fruit, sunflower seeds without shell)
Dinner: Boiled or Deepfried Potatoes - NOT the best I KNOW Or Buckwheat Or Homemade Soup Adding Combination of Onion, Cheese, Natural bread(from trader joe's), Drink Almond Milk Or Coconut Milk
Desert: Tea With cacao and honey
Anyone else has a similar or eat a healthy or raw food lifestyle please comment on what you eat and where you live and a age range please :)
(take into account i live in California USA and am 16 years old and this is an example of a daly food intake Also ill slip something unhealthy into there once in awhile - not very often mabey like 1 time every 5 months :) like a candy or something (im not perfect)

item.title: Food Habits ( Healthy Living )
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Crown2, post:43, topic:435446”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=538166.msg3938878#msg3938878 date=1331256140]

I know I shouldn’t eat McDonald’s but it is just so damn good. And let’s be honest, as a teenager, you can eat whatever the hell you want as long as your growing and playing a sport.

lol thats what i used to think but think of your body as a car and gas is the food if u use bad gas and dont take care of your body eventually it will stop working but if you take care of it will work for a long time
[/quote]… But the body also has 10X more t-cells, leukocytes, and and cells that rebuild the body than an adult

? in a young adult than i an adult or what did you mean? still your causing those cells harm because their running on bad fuel[/quote]

Bad fuel is still better than no fuel. I don’t eat McDonald’s every day, just when I am hungry and have a little bit of money to spend. I workout and end up burning those calories anyway. I went from being 215lbs as a freshman to 250lbs as a sophomore. I look the same except I’m taller. I eat more fast food as a sophomore but I’m healthier.

Read full topic

Breakfast
Tea (not in packet or bag) with honey and/or 86% cacao (not cocoa)
(from distilled or spring water)
Oatmeal (cooked in spring water gotten from a underground pump by my house or distilled water)
Fruit

Snacks: (throughout school day)
Raw Almonds
Raw Sunflower Seeds

Lunch:
Fruit’s
Vegetable’s
Mission corn chips (sometimes)
Granola Bar (with the least ingredients that i can find in a grocery store)
All natural trail mix or make my own (usually dried cranberry, almonds or peanuts, soy beans, other dried fruit, sunflower seeds without shell)

Dinner:
Boiled or Deepfried Potatoes - NOT the best I KNOW
Or Buckwheat Or Homemade Soup
Adding Combination of Onion, Cheese, Natural bread(from trader joe’s),
Drink Almond Milk Or Coconut Milk

Desert:
Tea With cacao and honey

Anyone else has a similar or eat a healthy or raw food lifestyle please comment on what you eat and where you live and a age range please

(take into account i live in California USA and am 16 years old and this is an example of a daly food intake Also ill slip something unhealthy into there once in awhile - not very often mabey like 1 time every 5 months like a candy or something (im not perfect)

But it’s good more people are starting to eat healthy. :)[/quote]

item.description:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:27, topic:435446”]@Crown2 I do not drink soda or eat out at fast food places unless it is Noodles and Company or Chipotle. Real men eat sprouts. Pansy.[/quote]
Chipotle <3
